Wikipedia contains 5,562,961 pages.
There are a total of 427,834,963 links between Wikipedia pages.
8,148,752 Wikipedia pages are actually just redirects to other pages.
"List of current U.S. state legislators" is the Wikipedia page with the highest number of outgoing links (9,769).
"List of people from Illinois" is the Wikipedia page with the second highest number of outgoing links (8,049).
"List of least concern birds" is the Wikipedia page with the third highest number of outgoing links (7,901).
"List of stage names" is the Wikipedia page with the fourth highest number of outgoing links (6,661).
"List of birds of the world" is the Wikipedia page with the fifth highest number of outgoing links (6,232).
"Geographic coordinate system" is the most linked to page on Wikipedia (1,047,096 incoming links).
"International Standard Book Number" is the second most linked to page on Wikipedia (955,957 incoming links).
"United States" is the third most linked to page on Wikipedia (474,245 incoming links).
"Virtual International Authority File" is the fourth most linked to page on Wikipedia (429,737 incoming links).
"Time zone" is the fifth most linked to page on Wikipedia (358,963 incoming links).
There are only 1,300 (0.02%) Wikipedia pages which link to no other pages.
There are 157,457 Wikipedia pages (2.83%) which are not linked to from any other page.
The first Wikipedia page title in alphabetical order is "!!".
The last Wikipedia page title in alphabetical order is "ìàñ".

There are 252 Wikipedia pages whose titles are just a single character, including "≈í", "‚Üì", and "ËÜæ".
Only 17 Wikipedia page titles begin with an exclamation mark, one of which is "!O!ung_language".
8,841 Wikipedia pages (0.16%) have a title which contains an exclamation mark.
Only 17 Wikipedia page titles begin with a question mark, one of which is "?:_A_Question_Mark".
3,601 Wikipedia pages (0.06%) have a title which contains a question mark.
4,826,829 Wikipedia pages (86.7%) have a title which contains a space.
736,132 Wikipedia pages (13.2%) have a title which does not contain a space.
A single or double quotation mark can be found in 160,631 Wikipedia page (2.89%), leading to countless parsing issues.

The "List of lists of lists" page is a list of pages that are lists of list pages on the English Wikipedia.
The "Order of magnitude" page lists "yocto-" (10^-24) and "yotta-" (10^24) as the smallest and largest magnitude prefixes.
The "Names of large numbers" page contains words like "googol" (10^100) and "millinillion" (10^3003).
An "Illegal prime" is a prime number that represents information whose possession or distribution is forbidden in some legal jurisdictions.
